attributes.action: guarantee that the FM radio service will not be discontinued in favour of all-digital transmissions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
TV broadcasting is being moved to digital, and UHF transmissions are currently being phased out.  

On 16 June the Government published its Digital Britain Report.  This proposes that a similar process should now be undertaken for radio. All radio transmissions would become digital and all FM and AM receivers obsolete from 2015, just six years away - though it is be no means clear that quality countrywide digital coverage can be obtained within that timescale.  Moreover, most households have many radios, and replacing them (including car radios and hi-fi tuners) would be burdensome and expensive for the public.  

The beneficiaries of such a change would be the Government (receipts from the sale of bandwidth), digital radio manufacturers (mostly overseas) and broadcasting companies.

We believe that a change of this sort would not be in the public interest, and that any need for additional Government receipts would be better met by other means.
